text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the model to highlight that an occupier must have a right 'at the time of the disposition' (i.e., the sale). The candidate answer discusses the occupier's rights generally, how they might be affected by the sale (Section 5: 'Sale of the property doesn\u2019t automatically end occupiers\u2019 rights'), and the difference between tenancy and licence, but it never explicitly states or highlights the legal principle that the right must exist *at the time of the disposition* for the buyer to be bound by it.", "criterion_id": "b1d17dc7-cd11-411d-88af-47cab931fcfe"}
